main event: A civilian observer reported a sighting of one unidentified object exhibiting bright points of light that rotated clockwise near Columbus, Indiana on December 10, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as a circular ring of smoke with a diameter of approximately 30 to 35 feet., The lights from the object were observed to disappear rapidly while maneuvering in formation., Witnesses noted that the object emitted no sound during the sighting., The sighting lasted approximately four minutes, with the object moving from NW to SE., Other witnesses included pilots and a civil air patrol officer, confirming the unusual aerial lights.
sighted object: circular ring of smoke or bright points of light
